info.title: Twilio SMS
info.description: Twilio's Programmable SMS API helps you add robust messaging capabilities to your applications. Please read pricing details carefully.

parameters.name: inLata
parameters.description: Limit results to a specific local access and transport area (LATA). Given a phone number, search within the same LATA as that number. Applies to only phone numbers in the US and Canada.

parameters.name: nearLatLong
parameters.description: Given a latitude/longitude pair lat,long find geographically close numbers within distance miles. Applies to only phone numbers in the US and Canada.

parameters.name: contains
parameters.description: The pattern on which to match phone numbers. Valid characters are *, 0-9, a-z, and A-Z. The * character matches any single digit. For examples, see Example 2 and Example 3. If specified, this value must have at least two characters.

parameters.name: inPostalCode
parameters.description: Limit results to a particular postal code. Given a phone number, search within the same postal code as that number. Applies to only phone numbers in the US and Canada.

parameters.name: areaCode
parameters.description: The area code of the phone numbers to read. Applies to only phone numbers in the US and Canada.

parameters.name: inRateCenter
parameters.description: Limit results to a specific rate center, or given a phone number search within the same rate center as that number. Requires in_lata to be set as well. Applies to only phone numbers in the US and Canada.

parameters.name: nearNumber
parameters.description: Given a phone number, find a geographically close number within distance miles. Distance defaults to 25 miles. Applies to only phone numbers in the US and Canada.

parameters.name: inRegion
parameters.description: Limit results to a particular region, state, or province. Given a phone number, search within the same region as that number. Applies to only phone numbers in the US and Canada.

parameters.name: excludeAllAddressRequired
parameters.description: Whether to exclude phone numbers that require an Address. Can be: true or false and the default is false.

parameters.name: smsEnabled
parameters.description: Whether the phone numbers can receive MMS messages. Can be: true or false.

parameters.name: distance
parameters.description: The search radius, in miles, for a near_ query. Can be up to 500 and the default is 25. Applies to only phone numbers in the US and Canada.

parameters.name: inLocality
parameters.description: Limit results to a particular locality or city. Given a phone number, search within the same Locality as that number.

parameters.name: excludeLocalAddressRequired
parameters.description: Whether to exclude phone numbers that require a local Address. Can be: true or false and the default is false.

parameters.name: excludeForeignAddressRequired
parameters.description: Whether to exclude phone numbers that require a foreign Address. Can be: true or false and the default is false.

parameters.name: beta
parameters.description: Whether to read phone numbers that are new to the Twilio platform. Can be:  true or false and the default is true.

parameters.name: CountryCode
parameters.description: The ISO-3166-1 country code of the country from which to read phone numbers.

parameters.name: AccountSid
parameters.description: The SID of the Account requesting the AvailablePhoneNumber resources.

get.description: Returns a list of available toll free phone numbers

parameters.name: IsoCountry
parameters.description: The ISO country code of the pricing information to fetch.

parameters.name: smartEncoded
parameters.description: Whether to detect Unicode characters that have a similar GSM-7 character and replace them. Can be: true or false.

parameters.name: messagingServiceSid
parameters.description: The SID of the Messaging Service you want to associate with the Message. Set this parameter to use the Messaging Service Settings and Copilot Features you have configured and leave the from parameter empty. When only this parameter is set, Twilio will use your enabled Copilot Features to select the from phone number for delivery.

parameters.name: mediaUrl
parameters.description: The URL of the media to send with the message. The media can be of type gif, png, and jpeg and will be formatted correctly on the recipient's device. Other types of media are also accepted. The media size limit is 5MB. To send more than one image in the message body, provide multiple media_url parameters in the POST request. You can include up to 10 media_url parameters per message. You can send images in an SMS message in only the US and Canada.

parameters.name: forceDelivery
parameters.description: Reserved

parameters.name: interactiveData
parameters.description: A JSON string that represents an interactive message. An interactive message is a category of messages that includes a list picker, a time picker, and an Apple Pay request.

parameters.name: maxPrice
parameters.description: The maximum total price in US dollars that you will pay for the message to be delivered. Can be a decimal value that has up to 4 decimal places. All messages are queued for delivery and the message cost is checked before the message is sent. If the cost exceeds max_price, the message will fail and a status of Failed is sent to the status callback. If MaxPrice is not set, the message cost is not checked.

parameters.name: statusCallback
parameters.description: The URL we should call using the status_callback_method to send status information to your application. If specified, we POST these message status changes to the URL: queued, failed, sent, delivered, or undelivered. Twilio will POST its standard request parameters as well as some additional parameters including MessageSid, MessageStatus, and ErrorCode. If you include this parameter with the messaging_service_sid, we use this URL instead of the Status Callback URL of the Messaging Service. URLs must contain a valid hostname and underscores are not allowed.

parameters.name: forceOptIn
parameters.description: Whether to forcefully whitelist a from:to pair. Can be: true or false.

parameters.name: validityPeriod
parameters.description: How long in seconds the message can remain in our outgoing message queue. After this period elapses, the message fails and we call your status callback. Can be between 1 and the default value of 14,400 seconds. After a message has been accepted by a carrier, however, we cannot guarantee that the message will not be queued after this period. We recommend that this value be at least 5 seconds.

parameters.name: applicationSid
parameters.description: The SID of the application that should receive message status. We POST a message_sid parameter and a message_status parameter with a value of sent or failed to the application's message_status_callback. If a status_callback parameter is also passed, it will be ignored and the application's message_status_callback parameter will be used.

parameters.name: provideFeedback
parameters.description: Whether to confirm delivery of the message. Set this value to true if you are sending messages that have a trackable user action and you intend to confirm delivery of the message using the Message Feedback API. This parameter is false by default.

parameters.name: to
parameters.description: The destination phone number in E.164 format for SMS/MMS or Channel user address for other 3rd-party channels.

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: The text of the message you want to send. Can be up to 1,600 characters in length.

parameters.name: from
parameters.description: A Twilio phone number in E.164 format, an alphanumeric sender ID, or a Channel Endpoint address that is enabled for the type of message you want to send. Phone numbers or short codes purchased from Twilio also work here. You cannot, for example, spoof messages from a private cell phone number. If you are using messaging_service_sid, this parameter must be empty.

parameters.name: AccountSid
parameters.description: The SID of the Account that created the Message resources to update. Obtained from the Get AccountSid Endpoint.

post.description: When creating a new message via the API, you must include the To parameter. This value should be either a destination phone number or a Channel address. You also need to pass a Body or MediaUrl containing the message's content.

parameters.name: from
parameters.description: Read messages sent from only this phone number or alphanumeric sender ID.

parameters.name: dateSent
parameters.description: The date of the messages to show. Specify a date as YYYY-MM-DD in GMT to read only messages sent on this date. For example: 2009-07-06. You can also specify an inequality, such as DateSent<=YYYY-MM-DD, to read messages sent on or before midnight on a date, and DateSent>=YYYY-MM-DD to read messages sent on or after midnight on a date.

parameters.name: to
parameters.description: Read messages sent to only this phone number.

parameters.name: AccountSid
parameters.description: The SID of the Account that created the Message resources to update. Obtained from the Get AccountSid Endpoint.

get.description: Returns a list of messages associated with your account. The list includes paging information.

parameters.name: AccountSid
parameters.description: The SID of the Account that created the Message resources to update. Obtained from the Get AccountSid Endpoint.

parameters.name: Sid
parameters.description: The Twilio-provided string that uniquely identifies the Message resource to update.

delete.description: Deletes a message record from your account. Once the record is deleted, it will no longer appear in the API and Account Portal logs.  If successful, returns HTTP 204 (No Content) with no body.

parameters.name: AccountSid
parameters.description: The SID of the Account that created the Message resources to update. Obtained from the Get AccountSid Endpoint.

parameters.name: Sid
parameters.description: The Twilio-provided string that uniquely identifies the Message resource to update.

get.description: Returns a single message specified by the provided Message {SID}.

parameters.name: Sid
parameters.description: The Twilio-provided string that uniquely identifies the Message resource to update.

parameters.name: AccountSid
parameters.description: The SID of the Account that will create the resource. Obtained from the Get AccountSide Endpoint

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: The text of the message you want to send. Can be up to 1,600 characters long.

post.description: Updates the body of a Message resource.  This action is primarily used to redact messages: to do so, POST to the above URI and set the Body parameter as an empty string: "". This will allow you to effectively redact the text of a message while keeping the other message resource properties intact.

parameters.name: MessageSid
parameters.description: The SID of the Message resource that this Media resource belongs to.

parameters.name: AccountSid
parameters.description: The SID of the Account that created the Message resources to update. Obtained from the Get AccountSid Endpoint.

parameters.name: Sid
parameters.description: The Twilio-provided string that uniquely identifies the Media resource to delete

delete.description: Deletes Media from your account.  If successful, returns HTTP 204 (No Content) with no body.

parameters.name: MessageSid
parameters.description: The SID of the Message resource that this Media resource belongs to.

parameters.name: AccountSid
parameters.description: The SID of the Account that created the Message resources to update. Obtained from the Get AccountSid Endpoint.

parameters.name: Sid
parameters.description: The Twilio-provided string that uniquely identifies the Media resource to fetch

get.description: Returns a single media resource using one of several representations:

parameters.name: areaCode
parameters.description: The desired area code for your new incoming phone number. Can be any three-digit, US or Canada area code. We will provision an available phone number within this area code for you. You must provide an area_code or a phone_number. (US and Canada only).

parameters.name: identitySid
parameters.description: The SID of the Identity resource that we should associate with the new phone number. Some regions require an identity to meet local regulations.

parameters.name: phoneNumber
parameters.description: The phone number to purchase specified in E.164 format. E.164 phone numbers consist of a + followed by the country code and subscriber number without punctuation characters. For example, +14155551234.

parameters.name: statusCallbackMethod
parameters.description: The HTTP method we should use to call status_callback. Can be: GET or POST and defaults to POST.

parameters.name: statusCallback
parameters.description: The URL we should call using the status_callback_method to send status information to your application.

parameters.name: addressSid
parameters.description: The SID of the Address resource we should associate with the new phone number. Some regions require addresses to meet local regulations.

parameters.name: friendlyName
parameters.description: A descriptive string that you created to describe the new phone number. It can be up to 64 characters long. By default, this is a formatted version of the new phone number.

parameters.name: phoneNumberType
parameters.description: Allowed values: `local` `mobile` or `toll free`

parameters.name: AccountSid
parameters.description: The SID of the Account that will create the resource.

parameters.name: countryCode
parameters.description: The ISO-3166-1 country code of the country from which to buy a phone number.

post.description: Purchase a Twilio phone number to send an SMS

parameters.name: beta
parameters.description: Whether to include phone numbers new to the Twilio platform. Can be: true or false and the default is true.

parameters.name: phoneNumber
parameters.description: The phone numbers of the IncomingPhoneNumber resources to read. You can specify partial numbers and use '*' as a wildcard for any digit.

parameters.name: friendlyName
parameters.description: A string that identifies the IncomingPhoneNumber resources to read.

parameters.name: origin
parameters.description: Whether to include phone numbers based on their origin. Can be: twilio or hosted. By default, phone numbers of all origin are included.

parameters.name: AccountSid
parameters.description: The SID of the Account that created the IncomingPhoneNumber resources to read.

get.description: Retrieve a list of phone numbers associated with your account

parameters.name: inboundRequestUrl
parameters.description: A webhook request is made to the Inbound Request URL when a message is received by any phone number or shortcode associated to your Messaging Service. Set to null to disable inbound messaging.

parameters.name: stickySender
parameters.description: Configuration to enable or disable Sticky Sender on your Service Instance. Possible values are true and false. Default value is true.

parameters.name: areaCodeGeomatch
parameters.description: Configuration to enable or disable Area Code Geomatch. Possible values are true and false. Default value is false.

parameters.name: inboundMethod
parameters.description: The HTTP method used when making requests to the Inbound Request URL. Either GET or POST. Default value is POST.

parameters.name: fallbackToLongCode
parameters.description: Configuration to enable or disable Fallback to Long Code. Possible values are true and false. Default value is false.

parameters.name: fallbackUrl
parameters.description: A request is made to the Fallback URL if an error occurs with retrieving or executing the TwiML from you Inbound Request URL.

parameters.name: statusCallback
parameters.description: A webhook request is made to the Status Callback to pass status updates about your messages. These status updates let you know if your accepted message were successfully sent and delivered or if a delivery related error may have occurred.

parameters.name: smartEncoding
parameters.description: Configuration to enable or disable Smart Encoding. Possible values are true and false. Default value is true.

parameters.name: validityPeriod
parameters.description: Configuration to set the validity period of all messages sent from your Service, in seconds. Acceptable integers range from 1 to 14,400. Default value is 14,400.

parameters.name: mmsConverter
parameters.description: Configuration to enable or disable MMS Converter on your Service Instance. Possible values are true and false. Default value is true.

parameters.name: friendlyName
parameters.description: A human readable descriptive text for this resource, up to 64 characters.

post.description: The Services resource of Messaging represents a set of configurable behavior for sending and receiving Messages.

delete.description: When a Service is deleted, all phone numbers and short codes in the Service are returned to your Account.

parameters.name: smartEncoding
parameters.description: Configuration to enable or disable Smart Encoding. Possible values are true and false. Default value is true.

parameters.name: fallbackToLongCode
parameters.description: Configuration to enable or disable Fallback to Long Code. Possible values are true and false. Default value is false.

parameters.name: fallbackUrl
parameters.description: A request is made to the Fallback URL if an error occurs with retrieving or executing the TwiML from you Inbound Request URL.

parameters.name: stickySender
parameters.description: Configuration to enable or disable Sticky Sender on your Service Instance. Possible values are true and false. Default value is true.

parameters.name: areaCodeGeomatch
parameters.description: Configuration to enable or disable Area Code Geomatch. Possible values are true and false. Default value is false.

parameters.name: statusCallback
parameters.description: A webhook request is made to the Status Callback to pass status updates about your messages. These status updates let you know if your accepted message were successfully sent and delivered or if a delivery related error may have occurred.

parameters.name: inboundMethod
parameters.description: The HTTP method used when making requests to the Inbound Request URL. Either GET or POST. Default value is POST.

parameters.name: mmsConverter
parameters.description: Configuration to enable or disable MMS Converter on your Service Instance. Possible values are true and false. Default value is true.

parameters.name: validityPeriod
parameters.description: Configuration to set the validity period of all messages sent from your Service, in seconds. Acceptable integers range from 1 to 14,400. Default value is 14,400.

parameters.name: inboundRequestUrl
parameters.description: A webhook request is made to the Inbound Request URL when a message is received by any phone number or shortcode associated to your Messaging Service. Set to null to disable inbound messaging.

parameters.name: friendlyName
parameters.description: A human readable descriptive text for this resource, up to 64 characters.

post.description: You may specify one or more of the optional parameters above to update the Service's respective properties. Parameters not specified in your request are not updated.

parameters.name: AccountSid
parameters.description: The SID of the Account that will create the resource.

delete.description: Delete a Twilio phone number registered to your account

parameters.name: statusCallback
parameters.description: The URL we should call using the status_callback_method to send status information to your application.

parameters.name: addressSid
parameters.description: The SID of the Address resource we should associate with the phone number. Some regions require addresses to meet local regulations.

parameters.name: emergencyAddressSid
parameters.description: The SID of the emergency address configuration to use for emergency calling from this phone number.

parameters.name: emergencyStatus
parameters.description: The configuration status parameter that determines whether the phone number is enabled for emergency calling.

parameters.name: statusCallbackMethod
parameters.description: The HTTP method we should use to call status_callback. Can be: GET or POST and defaults to POST.

parameters.name: apiVersion
parameters.description: The API version to use for incoming calls made to the phone number. The default is 2010-04-01.

parameters.name: friendlyName
parameters.description: A descriptive string that you created to describe this phone number. It can be up to 64 characters long. By default, this is a formatted version of the phone number.

parameters.name: smsApplicationSid
parameters.description: The SID of the application that should handle SMS messages sent to the number. If an sms_application_sid is present, we ignore all of the sms_*_url urls and use those set on the application.

parameters.name: identitySid
parameters.description: The SID of the Identity resource that we should associate with the phone number. Some regions require an identity to meet local regulations.

parameters.name: voiceApplicationSid
parameters.description: The SID of the application we should use to handle phone calls to the phone number. If a voice_application_sid is present, we ignore all of the voice urls and use only those set on the application. Setting a voice_application_sid will automatically delete your trunk_sid and vice versa.

parameters.name: trunkSid
parameters.description: The SID of the Trunk we should use to handle phone calls to the phone number. If a trunk_sid is present, we ignore all of the voice urls and voice applications and use only those set on the Trunk. Setting a trunk_sid will automatically delete your voice_application_sid and vice versa.

parameters.name: voiceCallerIdLookup
parameters.description: Whether to lookup the caller's name from the CNAM database and post it to your app. Can be: true or false and defaults to false.

parameters.name: Sid
parameters.description: The Twilio-provided string that uniquely identifies the IncomingPhoneNumber resource to update.

parameters.name: AccountSid
parameters.description: The SID of the Account that created the IncomingPhoneNumber resource to update. For more information, see Exchanging Numbers Between Subaccounts.

parameters.name: AccountSid
parameters.description: The SID of the Account that created the IncomingPhoneNumber resource to fetch.

parameters.name: Sid
parameters.description: The Twilio-provided string that uniquely identifies the IncomingPhoneNumber resource to fetch.

get.description: Retrieve a Twilio phone number registered to your account

parameters.name: dateCreated
parameters.description: The date_created value, specified as YYYY-MM-DD, of the resources to read. You can also specify inequality, such as DateCreated<=YYYY-MM-DD for media generated at or before midnight on a date, and DateCreated>=YYYY-MM-DD for media generated at or after midnight on a date.

parameters.name: MessageSid
